opinion.court: Supreme Court of the United States
opinion.case_name: Miller-El v. Cockrell, Director, Texas Department of Criminal Justice, Institutional Division

opinion:
535 U.S. 903

MILLER-EL
v.
COCKRELL, DIRECTOR, TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE, INSTITUTIONAL DIVISION.

No. 01-7662.

Supreme Court of the United States.

March 4, 2002.

1

C. A. 5th Cir. [Certiorari granted, 534 U. S. 1122.] Order granting petition for writ of certiorari amended to read as follows: Motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis granted. Certiorari granted limited to the following question: "Did the Court of Appeals err in denying a certificate of appealability and in evaluating petitioner's claim under Batson v. Kentucky, 476 U. S. 79 (1986)?"
